channel.title: Projects on Rishika Malli
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Rishika Malli

item.title: Project 4: Purchase based on Social Network Ads
item.description: User details such as Gender, Age, and Salary used to classify the purchase of an item presented in Social Network Ads. Predict the future outcomes of purchase given the above details, for targeted marketing and recommendations, using Logistical Classification in R Programming Language. Visualization plot - Green and Tomato Red BG denote classification among Successful Purchase and not respectively based on training set. Highlight Green and Cherry Red points denote the prediction of user’s purchase based on test set.

item.title: Project 3: Factors that determine Admission
item.description: Cleansed the data and analyzed the factors that influence the admission of a student into a college from historical data, and determined the key drivers - Scores, LOR, CGPA and Research Performed Regression to find factors majorly affecting admission and also predict the admission of a particular student based on these key factors, using R programming language and Machine learning Optimized Linear and Logistical Regression to reach the best model Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 2: SmartCom for Differently-Abled
item.description: A real-time wearable device developed using cost-effective technologies that enable the deaf-blind user to communicate using Malossi language to a common man in the vicinity using GSM Module The Touch gestures is captured and processed into normal text message and speech, and further displayed on an Android Application Technologies used â€“ Python, Java, Raspberry Pi, Sensor Module, Gloves, PuTTY, and Android Application Awarded best Major Outgoing project at Open Day, 2018 BMSIT&M Reviewed & Published at IEEE - 2018 International Conference Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Project 1: NOTE-IT
item.description: E-Learning Web Application developed as a substitute for email data sharing of classroom resources - notes and assignments. Teachers can upload the question papers, assignments, and other learning material; Students can share notes and access the uploaded material Technologies used were HTML, CSS, PHP, SQL, Database, and Android Application Link to GitHub Repository
